meta.name: Track Investor Data from Crunchbase to Google Sheets for Market Analysis

parameters.content:
### üî∑ **SECTION 1: Getting the Data from Crunchbase**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. üïí **Daily Investor Data Trigger**
2. üåê **Fetch Crunchbase Investor Data**

---

#### üîç What Happens in This Section?

This section is all about **automatically pulling investor data from Crunchbase** on a scheduled basis, without any manual effort.

---

#### üïí 1. **Daily Investor Data Trigger**

> *"When should the automation run?"*

* This **Schedule Trigger** node starts your workflow automatically at your chosen time.
* For example, it could run every day at 8 AM.
* It removes the need to remember to check Crunchbase manually.

‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:*

> Even if you‚Äôre not technical, you just set the schedule and let n8n run this job every day while you sleep ‚òïüìä

---

#### üåê 2. **Fetch Crunchbase Investor Data**

> *"Where do we get the data from?"*

* This **HTTP Request** node sends a **POST request** to [Crunchbase‚Äôs API](https://data.crunchbase.com/docs).

* It includes a **filter** for organization types like `investor` and requests fields like:

  * `name`
  * `short_description`
  * `location_identifiers`
  * `investment_stage`

* Crunchbase replies with a **JSON** file full of matching investors.

‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:*

> You don‚Äôt need to open a browser or search anything. This step collects live investor data from Crunchbase and brings it into your workflow for you üöÄ

---

### ‚úÖ What This Section Gives You:

A **live, up-to-date snapshot** of investor information, **automatically pulled** from Crunchbase, without coding or clicking.

---

### üî∑ **SECTION 2: Processing and Saving the Data**

#### üß© Nodes:

3. üßÆ **Extract Investor Fields**
4. üìÑ **Append to Investor Sheet**

---

#### üîç What Happens in This Section?

Now that we have raw investor data, this section **cleans it up** and **stores it in a Google Sheet** for easy access and analysis.

---

#### üßÆ 3. **Extract Investor Fields**

> *"Let‚Äôs clean and format the response."*

* This **Code** node uses JavaScript to loop through the list of investors and extract just what you care about:

  * ‚úÖ Name
  * üìù Short description
  * üåç Location
  * üí∞ Investment stage

* Each investor becomes a **separate row-ready item** for Google Sheets.

‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:*

> You don‚Äôt need to look at messy data. This step reshapes it into a clean format automatically ‚ú®

---

#### üìÑ 4. **Append to Investor Sheet**

> *"Store it somewhere useful."*

* This **Google Sheets** node takes the cleaned data and **adds it to a selected sheet**.
* It works like a magic assistant, typing the investor data into your spreadsheet row-by-row.
* You now have a **running list** of investors to use for:

  * üìà Market research
  * üéØ Outreach planning
  * üí° Competitor benchmarking

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## ‚ú® n8n Workflow: Investor Data Automation from Crunchbase to Google Sheets --- ### üî∑ **SECTION 1: Getting the Data from Crunchbase** #### üß© Nodes: 1. üïí **Daily Investor Data Trigger** 2. üåê **Fetch Crunchbase Investor Data** --- #### üîç What Happens in This Section? This section is all about **automatically pulling investor data from Crunchbase** on a scheduled basis, without any manual effort. --- #### üïí 1. **Daily Investor Data Trigger** > *"When should the automation run?"* * This **Schedule Trigger** node starts your workflow automatically at your chosen time. * For example, it could run every day at 8 AM. * It removes the need to remember to check Crunchbase manually. ‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:* > Even if you‚Äôre not technical, you just set the schedule and let n8n run this job every day while you sleep ‚òïüìä --- #### üåê 2. **Fetch Crunchbase Investor Data** > *"Where do we get the data from?"* * This **HTTP Request** node sends a **POST request** to [Crunchbase‚Äôs API](https://data.crunchbase.com/docs). * It includes a **filter** for organization types like `investor` and requests fields like: * `name` * `short_description` * `location_identifiers` * `investment_stage` * Crunchbase replies with a **JSON** file full of matching investors. ‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:* > You don‚Äôt need to open a browser or search anything. This step collects live investor data from Crunchbase and brings it into your workflow for you üöÄ --- ### ‚úÖ What This Section Gives You: A **live, up-to-date snapshot** of investor information, **automatically pulled** from Crunchbase, without coding or clicking. ---
--- ### üî∑ **SECTION 2: Processing and Saving the Data** #### üß© Nodes: 3. üßÆ **Extract Investor Fields** 4. üìÑ **Append to Investor Sheet** --- #### üîç What Happens in This Section? Now that we have raw investor data, this section **cleans it up** and **stores it in a Google Sheet** for easy access and analysis. --- #### üßÆ 3. **Extract Investor Fields** > *"Let‚Äôs clean and format the response."* * This **Code** node uses JavaScript to loop through the list of investors and extract just what you care about: * ‚úÖ Name * üìù Short description * üåç Location * üí∞ Investment stage * Each investor becomes a **separate row-ready item** for Google Sheets. ‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:* > You don‚Äôt need to look at messy data. This step reshapes it into a clean format automatically ‚ú® --- #### üìÑ 4. **Append to Investor Sheet** > *"Store it somewhere useful."* * This **Google Sheets** node takes the cleaned data and **adds it to a selected sheet**. * It works like a magic assistant, typing the investor data into your spreadsheet row-by-row. * You now have a **running list** of investors to use for: * üìà Market research * üéØ Outreach planning * üí° Competitor benchmarking ‚úÖ *Beginner Benefit:* > You don‚Äôt copy-paste anything ‚Äî n8n writes investor data into your sheet for you. It‚Äôs like having a personal assistant with no salary üìäü§ñ --- ### ‚úÖ What This Section Gives You: A fully automated process that **cleans up Crunchbase data** and **stores it neatly** in Google Sheets ‚Äî ready for analysis, dashboards, or reporting. --- ### üéÅ Final Outcome ‚úÖ No coding needed ‚úÖ Runs on autopilot ‚úÖ Clean data in your sheet ‚úÖ Use for strategy, marketing, or VC tracking ---
